place.name: NORTH RAUCEBY
place.gazetteerText: RAUCEBY (North), a parish, with a village, in Sleaford district, Lincoln; near Ermine-street, and 3½ miles W by N of Sleaford r. station. Post-town, Sleaford-Acres, 3, 460. Real property, £3, 486. Pop., 279. Houses, 48. The manor belongs to the Marquis of Bristol. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £166.* Patron, Sir J.Thorold, Bart. The church is old but good, and has a recent spire. There are a national school, and charities £5. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

place.name: SOUTH RAUCEBY
place.gazetteerText: RAUCEBY (South), a parish, with a village, in Sleaford district, Lincoln; 3 miles W of Sleaford r. station. Post-town, Sleaford. Acres, 2, 430. Real property, £3, 743. Pop. in 1851, 367; in 1 861, 474. Houses, 94. The increase of pop. arose from improved cottage accommodation. The manor belongs to the Marquis of Bristol. R. Hall is the seat of A. Wilson, Esq. The parish has no church, and is ecclesiastically united with North Rauceby. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
